speaker: Narrator
content: The sound that awakened my son was something he'd heard only once before. Many years ago when he was quite young.
mark: awakened awaken 的过去式及过去分词 vt. 唤醒；唤起；使……意识到  vi. 觉醒；醒来；意识到 = woke wake的过去式及过去分词

speaker: Narrator
content: But he recognized it instantly. It was the sound of a family secret.
mark: instantly adv. 立刻，马上

speaker: Narrator
content: 7 days after my funeral, life on Wisteria Lane finally returned to normal, Which, for some of my friends, was unfortunate.
mark: unfortunate adj. 不幸的；令人遗憾的；不成功的
Life returned to normal, which, for some of my friends, was unfortunate. 这里用which不用that是因为后面是一个非限定性定语从句。非限定性定语从句中，有一种特殊情况，which可以指代前面整个主句而不只是前面一个名词。
对我的一些朋友来说，紫藤巷生活恢复正常这件事是不幸的。

speaker: Lynette
content: Now what?
mark: Now what? 又怎么了

speaker: son
content: Daddy's home!

speaker: Tom
content: Come on! Hey, is anybody home?

speaker: Lynette
content: I wasn't expecting you for a week.
mark: I wasn't expecting you 我没料到你会来；我没想到是你
I wasn't expecting you for a week. 我原本以为这一周内你都不会来；我已经快要不指望你了。

speaker: Tom
content: I have to go back to Frisco in the morning. But I got your call. You sounded a little frazzled.
mark: Frisco 弗里斯科（美国西部城市）
frazzled adj. 疲惫的 frazzle n. 疲惫，精疲力竭；烫皱，煮烂；烧尽 v. 使…疲惫不堪；使…被烫皱

speaker: Lynette
content: Yeah! It's been a little rough.
mark: It's been a little rough. 这段时间有点艰难；情况有点棘手
rough adj. （表面）粗糙的，不平的；艰难的，不愉快的；

speaker: Tom
content: Hi, Yeah, Peaches.
mark: Peach n. 桃子；桃树；桃红色

speaker: son
content: Daddy, Did you buy us any presents?

speaker: Tom
content: Oh, god, presents. Wait up. Let me see.
mark: Wait up 等一下：指稍等片刻，不要离开或继续前进。

speaker: Tom
content: But I'm not giving it to you unless you promise me to go outside right now and practise throwing for 20 minutes, okay? You promise?

speaker: Tom
content: Get out! Who's open? Go out. Deeper. Deeper. Touchdown!
mark: Deeper. Deeper. Touchdown! 远点.远点!接着! touchdown: 降落, 着陆

speaker: Lynette
content: You gotta be kidding. I'm exhausted. I look terrible. I'm covered in peaches.
mark: You gotta be kidding. 你一定是在开玩笑
I'm exhausted. 我筋疲力尽了；我累坏了

speaker: Tom
content: I'm sorry, baby, I gotta have you.

speaker: Lynette
content: Well, is it okay if I just lie here?
mark: is it ok if I do sth 我做…… 可以吗？ 用于礼貌地征求对方的意见

speaker: Tom
content: Absolutely.

speaker: Lynette
content: Wait. I gotta tell you I was having trouble with swelling. So the doctor took me off the pill. You just gotta put on a condom.
mark: have trouble with: 有病痛
swell v. （身体部位）肿胀，膨胀
take sb. off sth.常用搭配，使某人停止服用（药物等）
pill 药片，药丸；（女用）口服避孕药 （the pill）
The doctor took me off the pill 医生让我停止服用避孕药（或那种药丸）
condom 安全套，避孕套

speaker: Tom
content: A condom? What's the big deal? Let's risk it.
mark: What's the big deal? 有什么大不了的

speaker: Lynette
content: Let's risk it?
